intro: Koellia fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered koellia, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with narrow, gray-green leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Koellia fascicularis is adapted to harsh, dry environments and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
